sites.name: Promenade des Anglais
sites.description: A world-famous seafront boulevard, the Promenade des Anglais offers stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea and stretches for about 7 kilometers. It is a symbol of Nice, lined with palm trees, luxury hotels, and beaches. The promenade is perfect for strolling, cycling, or rollerblading.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busier during summer months with more tourists and events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Early mornings are less crowded.

sites.name: Castle Hill (Colline du Château)
sites.description: Offering panoramic views of Nice, the Castle Hill is a historic site with a park, waterfalls, and ruins of the old castle. It is a popular spot for both tourists and locals to enjoy a picnic or a leisurely walk.
sites.seasonal_notes: The view is particularly stunning at sunset. Spring and fall offer pleasant weather for hiking.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Wear comfortable shoes for the hike.

sites.name: Musée Matisse
sites.description: Dedicated to the works of Henri Matisse, this museum houses one of the world's most comprehensive collections of his paintings, drawings, and sculptures. It is located in a 17th-century villa and offers insights into the artist's development.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded during weekdays. Special exhibitions may attract more visitors.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online in advance to avoid queues.

sites.name: Vieille Ville (Old Town)
sites.description: The Old Town of Nice is a maze of narrow streets, colorful buildings, and lively markets. It is home to historic landmarks, charming cafes, and local artisan shops. The Cours Saleya market is a must-visit for fresh flowers and local produce.
sites.seasonal_notes: Very charming during the summer evenings when the streets are bustling with activity.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Early morning visits offer a quieter experience.

sites.name: Cathédrale Sainte-Réparate
sites.description: This baroque cathedral is situated in the heart of the Old Town. It is named after Nice's patron saint and features an impressive interior with elaborate decorations and beautiful frescoes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open throughout the year, but check for special services that might limit access.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful attire is recommended.

sites.name: Musée d'Art Moderne et d'Art Contemporain (MAMAC)
sites.description: MAMAC showcases a wide range of modern and contemporary art, with works by artists such as Yves Klein and Andy Warhol. The museum's architecture itself is a modernist landmark.
sites.seasonal_notes: Special exhibitions can increase visitor numbers, but generally manageable.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets are available online and at the entrance.

sites.name: Place Masséna
sites.description: The central square of Nice, Place Masséna is known for its vibrant red buildings, checkerboard pavement, and the iconic fountain. It hosts public events and is a hub for shopping and dining.
sites.seasonal_notes: The square is beautifully illuminated during the winter holidays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Great for evening strolls.

sites.name: Parc Phoenix
sites.description: A large botanical garden and zoo, Parc Phoenix features a wide variety of plants and animals. The park is home to one of Europe's largest greenhouses and offers interactive exhibits for children.
sites.seasonal_notes: Ideal for family visits, especially during spring when flowers are in bloom.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased on-site. Consider bringing a picnic.

sites.name: Russian Orthodox Cathedral
sites.description: A stunning example of Russian architecture, the Saint Nicholas Cathedral in Nice is the largest Eastern Orthodox cathedral in Western Europe. It features ornate interiors and a beautiful exterior with vibrant onion domes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for religious holidays that may affect visiting hours.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours are available and recommended for deeper insights.

sites.name: Cours Saleya Market
sites.description: A vibrant market in the heart of the Old Town, known for its flowers, fresh produce, and local specialties. The Cours Saleya transforms into an antiques market on Mondays.
sites.seasonal_notes: Bustling atmosphere, especially during summer and weekends.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Early visits offer the freshest finds.

sites.name: Jardin Albert 1er
sites.description: One of the city's oldest public gardens, Jardin Albert 1er is a green oasis in the city center, featuring fountains, sculptures, and a playground. It is adjacent to the Promenade des Anglais.
sites.seasonal_notes: Pleasant year-round, with a lively atmosphere during the summer.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Ideal for a relaxing break.

sites.name: Musée National Marc Chagall
sites.description: Dedicated to the works of Marc Chagall, this museum houses the largest public collection of his paintings, especially those related to biblical themes. The museum's setting and architecture complement the artworks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Special exhibitions may attract more visitors.
sites.booking_tips: Online ticket purchase is recommended to avoid lines.

sites.name: Mont Boron
sites.description: A lush hilltop park offering hiking trails and panoramic views of Nice and the surrounding Mediterranean coastline. It is a popular spot for picnics and outdoor activities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded in early mornings or late afternoons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring water and comfortable shoes.

sites.name: Place Garibaldi
sites.description: A historic square with beautiful arcades and a statue of Giuseppe Garibaldi. It is surrounded by cafes and shops, offering a lively atmosphere and a taste of local life.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular during evenings with locals dining out.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Enjoy a meal at one of the cafes.

sites.name: Parc du Château
sites.description: Located atop Castle Hill, this park offers stunning views, historical ruins, and beautifully landscaped gardens. It is a tranquil escape from the city's hustle.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for sunset views. Pathways can be slippery after rain.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Accessible by foot or lift.

sites.name: Avenue Jean Médecin
sites.description: A central shopping street in Nice, lined with a mix of high street and luxury stores, cafes, and restaurants. It is a bustling area that acts as a commercial hub.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busy during sales and holiday seasons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit on weekdays for a less crowded experience.

sites.name: Palais Lascaris
sites.description: A hidden gem in the Old Town, this 17th-century aristocratic mansion showcases baroque architecture and hosts a collection of musical instruments and period furnishings.
sites.seasonal_notes: A quieter alternative to larger museums.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available at the entrance. Guided tours enhance the experience.

sites.name: Place Rossetti
sites.description: A charming square in the heart of the Old Town, known for its lively atmosphere, ice cream parlors, and the beautiful Sainte-Réparate Cathedral. It is a perfect spot for enjoying a coffee and people-watching.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular during summer evenings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Try the famous Fenocchio ice cream.

sites.name: Opéra de Nice
sites.description: An elegant opera house that hosts a variety of performances, including opera, ballet, and concerts. It is renowned for its acoustics and architectural beauty.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check the schedule for seasonal performances and special events.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets should be booked in advance, especially for popular shows.

sites.name: Quai des États-Unis
sites.description: An extension of the Promenade des Anglais, this seafront walkway offers beautiful views of the Baie des Anges and is a popular spot for walking and cycling.
sites.seasonal_notes: Ideal for a morning walk or run. Can be windy during winter.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Combine with a visit to nearby beaches.

sites.name: Plage Beau Rivage
sites.description: One of Nice's most popular private beaches, offering sunbeds, umbrellas, and beachside dining. The beach features crystal-clear waters and stunning views of the Mediterranean.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peak season from June to September. Beach services available during summer months.
sites.booking_tips: Sunbed rentals available. Arrive early to secure a good spot.

sites.name: Plage de la Réserve
sites.description: A quieter alternative to the main beaches, offering a more relaxed atmosphere with beautiful views. The beach is popular with locals and offers a more authentic experience.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded than other beaches. Ideal for swimming and sunbathing.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring your own beach equipment.

sites.name: Port Lympia
sites.description: Nice's main port area, featuring colorful buildings, fishing boats, and a vibrant atmosphere. The port is home to restaurants, cafes, and offers beautiful views of the Mediterranean.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful at sunset. Popular for dining and evening strolls.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Great for photography and dining.

sites.name: Théâtre de Verdure
sites.description: An open-air theater located in the Jardin Albert 1er, hosting concerts, performances, and cultural events during the summer months. The venue offers a unique outdoor entertainment experience.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open during summer months. Check schedule for performances.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available online and at the venue. Arrive early for good seats.

sites.name: Cimiez Roman Ruins
sites.description: Ancient Roman ruins including an amphitheater, thermal baths, and archaeological remains. The site offers insights into Nice's Roman history and provides beautiful views of the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Combine with Matisse Museum visit.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided tours available.

sites.name: Musée des Beaux-Arts
sites.description: Housed in a beautiful 19th-century mansion, this museum features an impressive collection of paintings, sculptures, and decorative arts from the 16th to 20th centuries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded than other museums. Special exhibitions throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Free admission. Check for temporary exhibitions.

sites.name: Parc du Mont Boron
sites.description: A large hilltop park offering hiking trails, picnic areas, and panoramic views of Nice and the Mediterranean. The park is popular with locals for outdoor activities and relaxation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Spring offers blooming flowers and pleasant temperatures.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Wear comfortable walking shoes.

sites.name: Promenade du Paillon
sites.description: A modern urban park featuring water features, playgrounds, and green spaces. The park connects the city center with the train station and offers a peaceful escape from the urban environment.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular with families. Water features operate during warmer months.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Ideal for families with children.

sites.name: Chapelle du Saint-Sépulcre
sites.description: A beautiful baroque chapel located in the Old Town, featuring ornate decorations and religious artwork. The chapel is a peaceful place for reflection and photography.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Check for religious services.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful attire recommended.

sites.name: Galerie des Ponchettes
sites.description: A contemporary art gallery housed in a historic building near the Promenade des Anglais. The gallery showcases local and international artists with rotating exhibitions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for current exhibitions. Less crowded than major museums.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Free admission.

sites.name: Observatoire de Nice
sites.description: A historic astronomical observatory located on Mont Gros, offering guided tours and insights into astronomy. The observatory provides stunning views of Nice and the surrounding area.
sites.seasonal_notes: Tours available on specific days. Check schedule in advance.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking required for tours. Limited availability.

sites.name: Cimetière du Château
sites.description: A historic cemetery located on Castle Hill, featuring beautiful monuments and offering panoramic views of Nice. The cemetery is a peaceful place for reflection and photography.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Respectful behavior required.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Quiet and respectful atmosphere.

sites.name: Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild
sites.description: A stunning villa and gardens located in Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat, just outside Nice. The villa features beautiful architecture, art collections, and spectacular gardens with sea views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Spring offers blooming gardens.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking recommended. Combine with garden visit.

sites.name: Cap de Nice
sites.description: A scenic viewpoint offering panoramic views of the Mediterranean and the Nice coastline. The area is popular for photography and sunset viewing.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful at sunset. Can be windy during winter.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Great for photography.

sites.name: Gare de Nice-Ville
sites.description: Nice's main train station, featuring beautiful architecture and serving as a major transportation hub. The station connects Nice to other cities in France and Europe.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busy during peak travel seasons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for station access. Book train tickets in advance.

sites.name: Allianz Riviera
sites.description: A modern football stadium home to OGC Nice. The stadium hosts football matches and other sporting events, offering a great atmosphere for sports enthusiasts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Match schedules vary throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets in advance for matches. Check schedule online.
